alert.note: Alert for Aiken; Edgefield; Lexington; Richland; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 5:57PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Edgefield, northwestern Lexington, north central Aiken, southeastern Saluda and northwestern Richland Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 556 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Johnston, or 18 miles northwest of Aiken, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lexington, Batesburg-Leesville, Red Bank, Oak Grove, Edgefield, Saluda, Johnston, South Congaree, Ridge Spring, Edgefield County Airport, Saluda County Airport, Chapin, Gilbert, Summit, Monetta, Trenton, Ward, Cedar Grove Fire Station, Saluda Co Sheriff`s Office and Bundrick Island. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 35 and 58. Interstate 26 between mile markers 90 and 92. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central South Carolina.
